hypothesis_content.title: Low Correlation Altcoin Divergence in Neutral-Bull Transition
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market regime shifts from NEUTRAL to BULL (regime confidence > 65%), altcoins with the lowest 90-day correlation to BTC (<0.4) and positive price momentum (price > 20-day MA) will outperform high-correlation altcoins by a significant margin (>10% relative) over the subsequent 15 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Early bull markets reward idiosyncratic narratives and fundamental growth stories over pure beta plays. Altcoins with low historical correlation to BTC are likely driven by unique catalysts and are less constrained by BTC's price action, allowing for larger alpha generation as risk appetite returns.
entry_conditions: Market regime transitions from NEUTRAL to BULL (confidence > 65%)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Long low-correlation basket outperforms high-correlation (>0.7) altcoin basket by 10%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Regime shifts back to NEUTRAL or BEAR

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The performance spread between low-correlation and high-correlation altcoin baskets is less than 5% following regime shifts in backtest.
